multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing progressive hair loss and have noticed hairless patches on my head over the past 2 months.
Are the patches round and smooth?
No, the patches are patchy and ill-defined.
Have you experienced any itching or burning sensations on your scalp?
No, I haven't experienced any itching or burning on my scalp.
Do you have a history of similar hair loss in your family?
No, there is no family history of similar hair loss.
Have you taken any new medications or supplements before the onset of hair loss?
No, I have not taken any new medications or supplements before the onset of hair loss.
Have you been under significant stress lately before noticing the hair loss?
Yes, I have been feeling tense since my boyfriend broke up with me.
Final Diagnosis: Telogen Effluvium
